message.content:
cs.SE, cs.PL, cs.SY, cs.CR, cs.LG. 

The paper discusses a software engineering practice for preventing misconfigurations in production deployment, which falls under the scope of cs.SE (Software Engineering). The paper proposes treating configuration values as code and systematically testing them, which involves programming language concepts and techniques, making cs.PL (Programming Languages) a likely sub-category. The paper also discusses the impact of configuration changes on program behavior, which relates to cs.SY (Systems and Control). The paper addresses the issue of misconfigurations, which can lead to security vulnerabilities, suggesting cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) as another possible sub-category. Finally, the paper discusses new adequacy and quality metrics for configuration testing, which could involve machine learning techniques, making cs.LG (Machine Learning) a potential sub-category.
